  • Method Details

    • GetNextState

      public RemoveTileState GetNextState()
      Determines and returns the next state in the tile removal process. This method transitions from the current state to a predefined next state in the state machine governing the tile removal process for the game. It creates a new instance of the RemoveTileStatePreChoose class, which is associated with a specific phase of the tile removal logic.
      Specified by:
      GetNextState in class RemoveTileState
      Returns:
      A new instance of RemoveTileStatePreChoose representing the next state in the process.

    • StateMain

      public void StateMain(ArrayList<ArrayList<SpaceShipTile>> subShips, ShipBoard shipBoard, int playerID, int indexToPreserve, int waste) throws Exception
      Executes the main logic for the state. This method processes the removal of blocks from sub-ships, updates the ship matrix, and handles certain state-specific operations.
      Specified by:
      StateMain in class RemoveTileState
      Parameters:
      subShips - A list of sub-ships, represented as a 2D ArrayList of SpaceShipTile objects.
      shipBoard - The game board where the ship is located and the operation is performed.
      playerID - The ID of the player initiating this state operation.
      indexToPreserve - The index of the sub-ship that must be preserved during the operation.
      waste - An unused parameter; may represent additional logic or resources in the future.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during the processing of the state.

    • StateMain

      public void StateMain(ShipBoard shipBoard, int row, int col, boolean fromMistake) throws Exception
      Executes the main logic for the current state on the provided ShipBoard.
      Specified by:
      StateMain in class RemoveTileState
      Parameters:
      shipBoard - The ShipBoard instance representing the current state of the game.
      row - The row index of the operation to be performed on the ShipBoard.
      col - The column index of the operation to be performed on the ShipBoard.
      fromMistake - A boolean indicating whether the method is invoked as a result of a mistake.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the execution of the state logic.

    • chooseOneSubShip

      public void chooseOneSubShip(int index, int playerID) throws Exception
      Allows a player to choose one specific sub-ship from the list of available sub-ships after a split operation on the ship has occurred. This method updates the game state to reflect the player's choice.
      Specified by:
      chooseOneSubShip in class RemoveTileState
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the sub-ship to be selected from the list of sub-ships.
      playerID - the unique identifier of the player making the selection.
      Throws:
      Exception - if the provided player ID is invalid, the index is out of bounds, or if an error occurs during the selection process.
